scene_0: The scene opens with a blue road sign displaying directions to 'Clapham Common', 'Brixton', and 'Pekham', accompanied by a prominent arrow pointing to the left. Transitioning to a sunny day, a girl walks happily along the sidewalk, dressed in a black jacket, jeans, sneakers, and a vibrant purple scarf.
scene_1: Two road signs come into view—one positioned at the top and the other at the bottom. The top sign is divided into upper and lower sections. The upper section features the faded text 'Earlsfield Wimbledon' with a leftward arrow, along with a London Network and bicycle logo on the right. The lower section displays the faded text 'Balham Streatham' with a rightward arrow, accompanied by a London Network and bicycle logo on the left. The bottom sign depicts a faded image of a bicycle. The girl from the previous scene squints, struggling to read the worn-out sign. She retrieves her phone, encased in a white cover, from her jacket pocket.
scene_2: Continuing her walk, the girl holds a phone showing a navigational interface with the text 'Joe's Specialty Cakes' and a 'Start navigation' button.
scene_3: Indoors, an elderly man sits on a brown sofa, wearing a blue checkered shirt and a cozy grey cardigan. A door is visible behind the sofa, and a small table adorned with a gold decorative flower stands beside it. With a tablet in hand, he sets it on the sofa and makes his way to another couch to retrieve his active phone.
scene_4: In a sunlit setting, an old man holds his phone, displaying a chat conversation with Sally. The phone screen reflects a sun glare. The chat bubbles appear in different colors—green for Sally and blue for the old man. Sally asks about his visit tonight, to which he replies, 'I don't know, maybe around 6:00. Will that work for you?' Sally informs him that she will be gone by then, leaving the box on the front porch. He agrees, inquiring about the payment for the glasses.
scene_5: The girl from the previous scene enters a bricked-house through a black gate.
scene_6: A white background screen presents informative text, encouraging visitors to 'Visit w3.org/WAI/perspectives' for insights on Colors with Good Contrast. Dominating the screen is the W3C (Web Accessibility Initiative) text on a blue rectangle. The screen also features a copyright notice stating 'Copyright 2016 W3C (MUT, ERCIM, Keio, Beihang).'
